business.headline: Confident of good outcome under PM Modi: Hardeep Puri on US-India trade talksAs US-India trade talks resumed with the arrival of the US chief negotiator in India, Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas, Hardeep Singh Puri expressed confidence of a good outcome under PM Modi.

India–US trade talks resume with 'India First' focus, says Hardeep Singh PuriAs fresh trade talks begin between India and the US, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, in an exclusive interview with India Today said the government will prioritise national interests, with farmers and MSMEs at the heart of its strategy.

How will US-India trade talk impact markets ahead?Experts said that any progress in the India-US trade deal is likely to trigger short covering on Dalal Street and the market is also looking forward to pent-up consumer demand from Navaratri.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath flags regulatory risk for weekly optionsWeekly options in India are under scrutiny, and Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has warned about the mounting regulatory risks that could reshape trading in these short-term derivatives.
Sensex jumps 595 points, Nifty above 25,200; Kotak Bank gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 594.95 points to close at 82,380.69 points, while the NSE Nifty50 added 169.90 points to end at 25,239.10.

Apollo Tyres shares jump 2% after it's named India cricket team jersey sponsorApollo Tyres shares jumped to the day's high of Rs 490.80 after opening at Rs 479.45. Apollo Tyres shares closed at Rs 486.80, up 1.56% after the news.

Can a Rs 25,000 salary fund both your home and car?Think a Rs 25,000 salary can't get you a house and a car? Think again. With the right strategy and disciplined savings, even modest paychecks can turn into big dreams.

Mother Dairy slashes ghee, butter prices, tetra-pack milk cheaper by Rs 2Mother Dairy announced a cut in prices across its portfolio of dairy and processed foods, saying it is passing on the benefits of the government's GST 2.0 reforms directly to consumers.
Urban Company to debut on BSE, NSE: What investors can expect on listing dayUrban Company is set to list on the BSE and NSE on September 17, 2025 after its IPO was subscribed nearly 109 times.

Say cheese: Trump blinks on trade as talks resume with IndiaIndia-US trade negotiations have resumed, weeks after Trump imposed steep 50% tariffs last month. The US, now, doesn't want sweeping access to India's agricultural and dairy markets.

1-day ITR extension: Is it enough for taxpayers?Filing income tax returns turned into a nightmare this year, as taxpayers battled login errors, frozen screens and missed payments. Now, with just a one-day extension, many are asking, is that really enough?

System is tainted: Delhi family's 6-year fight over Rs 55,000 insurance claimIn this week's story, part of our ongoing series' Claim Denied,' we tell the story of a Delhi family whose insurance claim was denied and whose battle is still ongoing after six years.

entertainment.headline: Ileana D'Cruz reveals she almost quit Barfi! after Anurag Basu's outburstIleana D'Cruz shared that she almost quit 'Barfi' after director Anurag Basu lashed out at her on set, leaving her in tears. The actor said she was calmed down by producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, after which she reconciled with Basu and continued with the film.

Raghav Juyal shares why Aryan Khan rarely smiles on cameraRaghav Juyal shared that Aryan Khan avoids smiling on camera due to a "phobia," preferring to maintain a serious persona despite his playful side off-screen. Aryan is all set to make his directorial debut with the Netflix satire 'Ba***ds of Bollywood', releasing on September 18.

Vir Das says it's impossible to gauge sensitivities before show: Am not that artisteVir Das announced his new stand-up tour 'Sounds of India', celebrating the country's everyday rhythms from Kanyakumari to Kashmir. At the launch, the Emmy-winning comedian opened up about the challenge of balancing comedy with social responsibility.

Robert Redford, Oscar-winning actor and director, dies at 89Actor-director Robert Redford, known for his role in 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid', died at the age of 89. He was celebrated for his iconic roles and for founding the Sundance Institute, which nurtured independent filmmakers across the globe.

Jackie Shroff calls out traffic chaos after ambulance struggles to move in MumbaiJackie Shroff voiced concern over Mumbai's traffic after witnessing an ambulance stuck in a jam, warning that such delays could cost lives. The actor also made headlines for snapping at paparazzi over excessive flashlights before resuming his usual cheerful interactions.

Lakshmi Manchu reacts to sexist remark, questions Mahesh Babu going shirtless at 50Actor Lakshmi Manchu confronts a reporter for questioning her dressing sense. She raised concerns about gendered double standards in media interviews and advocated for greater responsibility among journalists.

Sabrina Carpenter, Justin Bieber and Karol G to headline Coachella 2026Coachella has revealed its headline acts for 2026, featuring Sabrina Carpenter, Justin Bieber and Karol G, with tickets set to go on sale this week.

Who is Mahieka Sharma? All about Hardik Pandya's new rumoured partnerHardik Pandya has sparked dating rumours with model Mahieka Sharma after a Reddit thread spotted a male figure in the background of her selfie. While neither has confirmed the speculation, social media is abuzz as fans connect the dots after Hardik's recent separation from Natasa Stankovic.

Shinchan goes desi: Director Masakazu Hashimoto on Bollywood, humour, Indian debutThe 33rd Shinchan film, 'Crayon Shin-chan the Movie: Super Hot! The Spicy Kasukabe Dancers' brings Japan's most notorious cartoon kid to India for the first time, mixing masala, mischief, and a lot of dance.

Nidradevi Next Door review: A technically brilliant film that deserves more loveRelease Date:Fri Sep 12, 2025Nidradevi Next Door review: This Kannada film written and directed by Suraag Sagar is a psychological drama flavoured with romance, that tastefully presents sensitive issues such as chronic insomnia due to emotional baggage.

Karanvir Sharma on saying no to Bigg Boss 19, choosing Kajol's The Trial 2Ahead of 'The Trial 2' premiere, actor Karanvir Sharma told IndiaToday.in that his biggest disadvantage in Bollywood has been his looks. He also opened up about turning down 'Bigg Boss 19' to prioritise the courtroom drama series.

Gen V Season 2 review: It's funnier, bloodier and paradoxically more tender'Gen V' season 2 review: The show arrives with sharper storytelling and a more hopeful tone. It honours the late Chance Perdomo while deepening its emotional and action-packed narrative.

Abir Gulaal first reviews out: Critics call Fawad Khan-Vaani's film frustratingFawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor's film 'Abir Gulaal' is barred from Indian release following the Pahalgam terror attack. It has drawn negative responses from critics worldwide, citing incoherent storytelling and lacklustre performances.
Vir Das ditches stand-up for a new cultural tour, announces Sounds of IndiaActor-comedian Vir Das has announced a new tour, 'Sounds of India'. The tickets for the tour will go live on September 18.

Varun Dhawan says actors cannot be entirely blamed for rising entourage costsActor Varun Dhawan addresses the ongoing debate about escalating actor entourage expenses. He emphasised that both actors and producers must share responsibility for industry costs and collaborate accordingly.

I'm not that cheap: Tanushree Dutta rejects Bigg Boss despite Rs 1.65 crore offerActor Tanushree Dutta shared that she has rejected offers to join 'Bigg Boss' for 11 years, despite being offered Rs 1.65 crore. She said the reality show is not aligned with her values, adding she is "not that cheap" to compromise her privacy for TRPs.

Monster trailer: Charlie Hunnam serves horror straight from its darkest sourceNetflix released the trailer for 'Monster: The Ed Gein Story', starring Charlie Hunnam. The series explores Ed Gein's crimes and their influence on Hollywood horror.

Mohanlal wears septum ring, holds trident in Vrusshabha poster, teaser date outThe makers of Mohanlal's upcoming period epic 'Vrusshabha' have announced that its first teaser will be unveiled on September 18.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 23: Amaal's aggressive captaincy leaves housemates miffedThe kitchen continues to be the hotspot of all major fights in 'Bigg Boss 19'. The latest episode of the reality show was no exception, with fights breaking out between Nehal Chudasama, Kunickaa Sadanand, and Amaal Mallik.

general news.headline: India refused third party role in truce talks: Pak minister busts Trump claimPakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar has admitted that India never accepted any third-party mediation in ceasefire talks. He said a ceasefire offer had come via the US, but India insisted the issue remain bilateral.

Nitish Kumar not weak link: Chirag Paswan confident of 225 seats for NDA in BiharIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, Chirag Paswan maintained that there was no tussle in the NDA regarding seat sharing. He also dismissed speculation of a rift with Nitish Kumar.

Masood Azhar's family 'torn into pieces' by India: Jaish admits Op Sindoor impactThis is the first public confirmation from within the Jaish-e-Mohammad regarding the fate of Masood Azhar's family after India hit the terror outfit's headquarters in Bahwalpur.

Push for Arab-Islamic Nato in meeting attended by Pak, TurkeyLeaders of Arab and Islamic nations pushed for an "Arab Nato" in a meeting of over 40 Muslim countries, including Pakistan and Turkey. Egypt, which has the Arab world's largest army, pitched it as a collective defence shield.

Say cheese: Trump blinks on trade as talks resume with IndiaIndia-US trade negotiations have resumed, weeks after Trump imposed steep 50% tariffs last month. The US, now, doesn't want sweeping access to India's agricultural and dairy markets.

Day 4 Live: Sarvesh Kushare finishes 6th with new personal-bestWorld Athletics Championships Day 4 Live: Sarvesh Kushare is currently in action as he eyes India's first medal in the high jump final in Tokyo. He is the first-ever Indian to ever qualify for the finals in the history of the tournament.

After boycott threat, sulking Pakistan cancel pre-match presser ahead of UAE clashPakistan have cancelled their pre-match press conference ahead of their Asia Cup 2025 clash against the UAE, sparking speculation of a boycott amid tensions with the ICC and ACC.

Robert Redford, Oscar-winning actor and director, dies at 89Actor-director Robert Redford, known for his role in 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid', died at the age of 89. He was celebrated for his iconic roles and for founding the Sundance Institute, which nurtured independent filmmakers across the globe.

Why humanities at IITs? Arts courses spark debate on Left liberal agendaAn illustration for a workshop on 'South Asian Capitalism(s)' at IIT Bombay sparked a controversy. Though IIT Bombay distanced itself from the event, the row has snowballed into a debate, with critics alleging that humanities were being used by Left liberals to "capture" India's tech institutes. Here are both sides of the argument and a balanced takeaway.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

Anti-immigrant UK leader Tommy Robinson has surprising take on IndiansDespite his hardline anti-immigrant stance, UK leader Tommy Robinson has repeatedly praised Indians, particularly Hindus, calling them allies who integrate into British life. Robinson, who recently led a massive rally through the heart of London, had pledged street muscle for Hindus, who he saw as distinctly different from other immigrants.

Shahid Afridi's anti-India rant amid handshake row has a Rahul Gandhi mentionShahid Afridi's tirade came on the heels of a controversy at the Asia Cup 2025, where Indian players pointedly refused to shake hands with their Pakistani counterparts after their Sunday match.

Is US corn attack linked to India's ethanol rush?US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick attacked India for not importing American corn. India was an exporter of maize till 2023 but the diversion of corn to produce ethanol for fuel blending turned it into an importer. DC's desperation as China skips its grains and India's corn imports are behind the Trump aide's attack.

Apollo Tyres named new sponsor for Indian cricket team after Dream11 exitApollo Tyres has replaced Dream11 as the official sponsor of the Indian cricket team. Both the men's side, currently competing in the Asia Cup, and the women's team, playing an ODI series against Australia, have been without a sponsor in recent matches.

Asia Cup withdrawal only honourable exit for below-par PakistanPakistan have threatened to withdraw from the Asia Cup if match referee Andy Pycroft is not removed for the remainder of the tournament. Is the abrupt exit the only way for Pakistan to avoid humiliation in the Super 4 stage?

Dehradun man clings to electric pole as river swells after cloudburst. Video viralA video of a man stranded on an electric pole in the flooded Tons River near Sudhowala in Dehradun has gone viral on social media.

Abir Gulaal first reviews out: Critics call Fawad Khan-Vaani's film frustratingFawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor's film 'Abir Gulaal' is barred from Indian release following the Pahalgam terror attack. It has drawn negative responses from critics worldwide, citing incoherent storytelling and lacklustre performances.

The Kerala Story: A health model haunted by serial outbreaksTouted as India's healthcare success story, Kerala now finds itself battling a grim pattern, one deadly outbreak after another. Experts warn: it's time to look beyond the applause and confront the cracks.

ICC rejects Pak's demand to drop Asia Cup match referee over handshake rowThe International Cricket Council has rejected Pakistan's demand to remove match referee Andy Pycroft from Asia Cup. Pakistan had threatened that if Pycroft was not removed, they would withdraw from the tournament.

Viral video of IAS officer's warm interaction with orphan girl delights InternetA touching video of Swapnil Wankhede, a 2016-batch IAS officer and Collector of Datia district in Madhya Pradesh, warmly interacting with an orphaned girl has gone viral.

Why Usain Bolt, once world's fastest man, now struggles to climb stairs?Once the world's fastest man, Usain Bolt has admitted that even climbing stairs is now a struggle. He says it leaves him breathless. The retired Jamaican sprinter still holds three world records but lives a slower life, building Lego and spending time with his children. Bolt has been dealing with scoliosis and a ruptured Achilles.

Nupur Bora: Assam officer caught in multi-crore scam was seen as a trailblazerNupur Bora, a 35-year-old Assam Civil Service officer, has been arrested by the Chief Minister's Special Vigilance Cell in a high-profile corruption case. Bora, currently serving as Circle Officer of Goroimari in Kamrup, was under surveillance for six months over allegations of irregular land transfers.

What I discovered about Colombo's quiet luxury and laid-back vibe on a weekend tripQuick weekend escapes are growing like never before, and not just to nearby destinations. Indians are flying abroad, with Sri Lanka fast becoming a favourite. Here's what we did when we checked into South Asia's first integrated resort over a weekend.

Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif may meet Trump next week, Asim Munir to join talks: ReportPakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif is likely to meet US President Donald Trump next week, with Army chief Asim Munir accompanying him for the talks, as per a report.

sports.headline: After boycott threat, sulking Pakistan cancel pre-match presser ahead of UAE clashPakistan have cancelled their pre-match press conference ahead of their Asia Cup 2025 clash against the UAE, sparking speculation of a boycott amid tensions with the ICC and ACC.

China Masters: PV Sindhu returns to form with crushing win vs Jakobsen in Round of 32PV Sindhu registered a commanding win over Denmark's Julie Dawall Jakobsen at the China Masters. Meanwhile, Ayush Shetty and the mixed doubles pair faced early exits, signalling tough competition ahead.

Pakistan to play matches at neutral venue Colombo at Women's T20 World Cup for BlindThe Cricket Association for the Blind in India (CABI) has added Colombo as a neutral venue for Pakistan's matches in the inaugural Women's T20 World Cup, originally set for Kathmandu, due to unrest in Nepal.

Why Usain Bolt, once world's fastest man, now struggles to climb stairs?Once the world's fastest man, Usain Bolt has admitted that even climbing stairs is now a struggle. He says it leaves him breathless. The retired Jamaican sprinter still holds three world records but lives a slower life, building Lego and spending time with his children. Bolt has been dealing with scoliosis and a ruptured Achilles.

Pakistan risks up to 16 million USD revenue loss if they pull out of Asia Cup 2025Should the Pakistan Cricket Board pull out of the ongoing Asia Cup, it could suffer a major loss in revenue worth up to 16 million USD.

World Athletics: Neeraj Chopra, Arshad Nadeem avoid early clash in qualificationNeeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem will not meet in the qualification round of the men's javelin at the World Championships, with the two arch-rivals placed in separate groups.

Day 4 Live: Sarvesh Kushare sets personal-best in high-jump finalWorld Athletics Championships Day 4 Live: Sarvesh Kushare is currently in action as he eyes India's first medal in the high jump final in Tokyo. He is the first-ever Indian to ever qualify for the finals in the history of the tournament.

Sam Konstas' century guides Australia A to 337 for 5, Harsh takes three wicketsSam Konstas struck a fluent 109 as Australia A reached 337 for 5 on the opening day of the first unofficial Test against India A at the Ekana Stadium on Tuesday, with Harsh Dubey claiming three crucial wickets to keep the hosts in contention.

Apollo Tyres named new sponsor for Indian cricket team after Dream11 exitApollo Tyres has replaced Dream11 as the official sponsor of the Indian cricket team. Both the men's side, currently competing in the Asia Cup, and the women's team, playing an ODI series against Australia, have been without a sponsor in recent matches.

Was told I won't jump again: Sreeshankar satisfied despite early exitMurali Sreeshankar is happy despite a mellow ending to the 2025 season. Told he would never jump again, the athlete is satisfied with the progress that he made this season.

Smriti Mandhana reclaims No.1 ODI ranking after fluent 58 vs AustraliaSmriti Mandhana reclaimed the No.1 ODI ranking with a half-century against Australia on September 14 in Mullanpur. She replaced England captain Nat Sciver-Brunt at the top.

Day 4 Live: Sarvesh Kushare sets personal-best in high-jump finalWorld Athletics Championships Day 4 Live: Sarvesh Kushare is currently in action as he eyes India's first medal in the high jump final in Tokyo. He is the first-ever Indian to ever qualify for the finals in the history of the tournament.

Sam Konstas' century guides Australia A to 337 for 5, Harsh takes three wicketsSam Konstas struck a fluent 109 as Australia A reached 337 for 5 on the opening day of the first unofficial Test against India A at the Ekana Stadium on Tuesday, with Harsh Dubey claiming three crucial wickets to keep the hosts in contention.

Both the men's side, currently competing in the Asia Cup, and the women's team, playing an ODI series against Australia, have been without a sponsor in recent matches.

Was told I won't jump again: Sreeshankar satisfied despite early exitMurali Sreeshankar is happy despite a mellow ending to the 2025 season. Told he would never jump again, the athlete is satisfied with the progress that he made this season.

Smriti Mandhana reclaims No.1 ODI ranking after fluent 58 vs AustraliaSmriti Mandhana reclaimed the No.1 ODI ranking with a half-century against Australia on September 14 in Mullanpur. She replaced England captain Nat Sciver-Brunt at the top.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
